e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it reflects a commitment to ethical financial reporting and transparency. While there may be some initial confusion among investors accustomed to the previous bias, establishing a no-bias practice fosters trust and credibility in the long run. This change aligns with regulatory expectations and can help mitigate potential legal risks, ultimately benefiting the company's reputation and stakeholder relations.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness. It should provide a true and complete picture of the company's financial performance without intentional biases or misrepresentations. Relevant considerations include aligning with regulatory standards, fostering investor trust, and ensuring that all stakeholders have equal access to reliable information. Additionally, an ethical policy should adapt to changing norms and expectations in the market while valuing the interests of both sophisticated and retail investors.
e6: Yes, I would like to ask management how they plan to communicate the change in reporting policy to investors to ensure their understanding and mitigate any potential confusion. Additionally, I would be interested in understanding how they will monitor investor sentiment and feedback following the transition to the new policy.
